clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Bardet-Biedl-Syndrome With Metformin for Evaluation of a Possible Visual Improvement
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Infantile and Juvenile Patients With Bardet-Biedl-Syndrome With Metformin. Evaluation of a Visual Improvement as a Side Effect of the Pediatric Treatment of Adipositas - a Prospective Pilot Study Without Control

brief_summary.textblock: In this prospective pilot study without control group children and young adults (10-25 years old) diagnosed with Bardet-Biedl syndrome and treated with Metformin for their adipositas will be evaluated for a possible additional effect of Metformin on visual acuity.

detailed_description.textblock:
Within experiments with animals a positive effect of Metformin concerning the photo receptors was shown. Several patients of the university hospital T체bingen with Bardet-Biedl-Syndrome and Metformin therapy due to their adipositas reported a subjective improvement of the visual acuity which was confirmed by opthalmologic tests.
This will be checked in a prospective pilot study without control group including children and young adults (10-25 years old) diagnosed with Bardet-Biedl syndrome and treated with Metformin for their adipositas. Therefore a possible additional effect of Metformin on visual acuity will be evaluated under controlled conditions.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Prospective pilot study without control group

primary_outcome.description: Course of visual acuity according to appropriate table

secondary_outcome.description: Course visual acuity defined as number of letters read
Course of results of static perimetry given by measurement of light contrast sensitivity within at least 5 central points.
Course of results of kinetic perimetry given by mapping the visual field sensitivity boundaries using Goldmann perimetry
Course of values of ERG dim-flash
Course of values of ERG standard flash at 3 ods/m2
Course of values of ERG cone-single-flash at 30cd/m2
Course of values of ERG measured by 30-Hz-Flicker in all patients
Course of results of measurement of VEP amplitude
Course of results of measurement of VEP latency time
Course of central thickness of retina measured by OCT

arm_group.description: Metformin therapy once daily for 24 weeks with a dose of 500, 850 or 1000 mg depending on body weight

intervention.description: 500, 850 or 1000 mg depending on body weight once daily for 24 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- clinically confirmed Bardet-Biedl-syndrome
- Visual acuity between 0.05 and 0.8
- Age >=10 year to <25 years
- Visual field III4e or V4e with diameter >=5째, if II4e not seen
- informed consent of patient and/or legal representative
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hypoglycaemia (<50mg/dl)
- Therapy with Metformin within the last three months
- Participation in another clinical trial
- pregnancy, lactation
- any contra indication concerning Metformin therapy
- Renal failure (creatinine clearance < 60ml/min)
- any acute disorder accompanied by clouding of consciousness
- acute or chronic disorders possible accompanied by tissue hypoxia
- Liver insufficiency, alcohol abuse
- not fluent in German language
